title: Drivers backup and inject in offline XP/2003 systems

forumNotes.author: ZEE
forumNotes.content:
Hi ppl, long time no see... sorry!

I wonder if anybody knows of a good utility to make a driver backup from a offline disk

windows XP/2003 or later and then a driver injection in a offline disk with...

The purpose is to backup all drivers of a offline disk (call it computer-A)

and then inject them on a new offline disk already with XP/2003

to put in computer-A and boot flawless

I already done it by manually this way:

. grab all driver files in %windir%\\system32, %windir%\\system32\\inf, %windir%\\system32\\drivers

and put them in the new offline disk

. retrieve registry HKLM-\>ControlSetXXX, then inject in the destination registry hive offline

and works ok, if you do not \<\<MISS\>\> a file... which is easy to do...

I try 2 utilities to solve this manual work : DoubleDriver and DriverBackup

And everything works ok... until the restore in the new offline disk!

the problem is that this utils do not have a process to restore drivers to a offline disk...

?any ideas
